src:
Edhy Prabowo Sebut Cina Siap Tampung Ikan dari RI
07 Nov 2019, 05:55 by Antara, Dewi Rina Cahyani
TEMPO.CO, Jakarta - Menteri Kelautan dan Perikanan Edhy Prabowo menyatakan Republik Rakyat China menyatakan siap untuk meningkatkan perdagangan sektor perikanan termasuk hasil berbagai perikanan yang dibudidayakan di Indonesia.
Menteri Edhy Prabowo dalam acara Indoaqua 2019 di Jakarta, menyatakan hal tersebut setelah Duta Besar China berkunjung ke kantor Kementerian Kelautan dan Perikanan (KKP) beberapa hari lalu. "Dubes China menawarkan banyak hal, antara lain pasarnya (populasi China) besar," kata Edhy Prabowo, Kamis, 7 November 2019.
Menurut Edhy Prabowo, Dubes China mengaku heran karena potensi budi daya Indonesia sangat besar tetapi saat ini belum mendominasi ekspor ke China. Dia melanjutkan Dubes China memaparkan bahwa saat ini Indonesia masih menjadi pemasok ekspor nomor tujuh ke China, padahal melihat berbagai potensi yang ada seharusnya RI berada di peringkat teratas.
Untuk itu, Edhy Prabowo juga mengajak berbagai pembudidaya agar jangan khawatir terhadap pemasaran hasil produksi mereka, karena pasti pemerintah akan selalu mencari jalan keluarnya.
Sebagaimana diwartakan, Republik Rakyat China menjajaki peluang peningkatan kerja sama dalam sektor kelautan dan perikanan dengan Republik Indonesia, terutama karena kedua negara juga telah memiliki relasi yang baik dalam berkolaborasi.
"Indonesia memiliki wilayah perairan yang luas dan sumber daya bahari yang melimpah. Sementara China memiliki pasar yang luar biasa besar," kata Duta Besar China untuk Indonesia, Xiao Qian, saat mengunjungi Menteri Kelautan dan Perikanan Edhy Prabowo, yang terjadi di Kantor KKP, Jakarta, awal November 2019.
text:
Edhy Prabowo Called China Ready to Catch Fish from RI
Nov 7 2019, 5:55 a.m. by Antara, Dewi Rina Cahyani
TEMPO.CO, Jakarta - Minister of Maritime Affairs and Fisheries, Edhy Prabowo, stated that the People's Republic of China has expressed its readiness to increase trade in the fisheries sector, including the results of various fisheries cultivated in Indonesia.
Minister Edhy Prabowo in the 2019 Indoaqua event in Jakarta, stated this after the Chinese Ambassador visited the office of the Ministry of Maritime Affairs and Fisheries (KKP) a few days ago. "The Chinese ambassador offers many things, including a large (Chinese) market," Edhy Prabowo said, Thursday, November 7, 2019.
According to Edhy Prabowo, the Chinese ambassador said he was surprised because Indonesia's potential for cultivation was very large but at present it did not dominate exports to China. He continued the Chinese Ambassador explained that currently Indonesia is still the number seven export supplier to China, even though seeing that there are various potentials, Indonesia should be ranked top.
For this reason, Edhy Prabowo also invited various farmers not to worry about marketing their products, because the government would always find a way out.
As reported, the People's Republic of China explores opportunities for increased cooperation in the maritime and fisheries sector with the Republic of Indonesia, especially since the two countries also have good relations in collaboration.
"Indonesia has vast territorial waters and abundant marine resources. While China has an unusually large market," said Chinese Ambassador to Indonesia, Xiao Qian, when visiting Maritime and Fisheries Minister Edhy Prabowo, which took place at the KKP Office, Jakarta , early November 2019.
